bug.short_desc: Exception when exceeding IE's URL length limit

long_desc.thetext:
Internet Explorer has a hardcoded URL length limit of 2083 characters [1]. In the Playground, where sample code is appended to the URL, this limit is fairly easy to exceed, causing an exception when trying to run the code.
[1] http://support.microsoft.com/kb/208427

Unfortunately, this is a browser limitation in IE we cannot easily workaround. Well, one could try to reduce size by some sort of zipping or packaging (e.g. http://dean.edwards.name/packer/), but that may not be as practical as it seems. For general info about URL lengths in browsers, see http://www.boutell.com/newfaq/misc/urllength.html
Regarding the IE limitation, we should make sure that this doesn't cause a problem when editing code inside the playground. The URL just shouldn't be used for code that exceeds the limit.

Apparently this has been addressed lately in bug #2772, marking this one as a duplicate.
